public ?Futureparallel\Runtime::run Closuretask
Shall schedule task for execution in parallel.
public ?Futureparallel\Runtime::run Closuretask arrayargv
Shall schedule task for execution in parallel, passing argv at execution time.

&reftitle.parameters;
task
A Closure with specific characteristics.
argv
An array of arguments with specific characteristics to be passed to task at execution time.

refsect1.title: Task Characteristics
refsect1.para:
Closures scheduled for parallel execution must not:
accept or return by reference accept or return objects execute a limited set of instructions

Instructions prohibited in Closures intended for parallel execution are:
declare (anonymous) class use (by-reference) yield

note.para: Only declare class instructions are prohibited in closures or functions that are nested in tasks, no instructions are prohibited in the files which the task may include.

refsect1.title: Arguments Characteristics
refsect1.para:
Arguments must not:
contain references contain objects contain resources
In the case of file stream resources, the resource will be cast to the file descriptor and passed as int where possible, this is unsupported on Windows.

refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.returnvalues;
The return \parallel\Future must not be ignored when the task contains a return or throw statement.

warning.para: Shall throw \parallel\Runtime\IllegalFunction if task is a closure created from an internal function.
Shall throw \parallel\Runtime\IllegalInstruction if task contains illegal instructions.
Shall throw \parallel\Runtime\IllegalParameter if task accepts or argv contains illegal variables.
Shall throw \parallel\Runtime\IllegalReturn if task returns illegally.
